pros: Good overall environment and easy to get assistance
cons: Ok benefits but cld use some improvement

pros: Decent pay, will work you as much as you want
cons: Got injured by a patient and instead of trying to find me a new position, they decided to shove me out. Forced to get a new job. I could have taken an offer for a lousy settlement, but never work for them again. I wish I would have sued. I'm permanently injured. I would have been better off letting the patient fall. Profits before people...that's the uhc way.

pros: Competitive pay . Unit manager was great
cons: Stafffing ratios not so great

review_title: Be prepared to be short staffed daily
pros: The pay is good for the area. Bonuses occasionally. Self scheduling would be better if it didn't get edited a lot.
cons: Unable to transfer to work other floors. Talked down to like you're a child despite being educated. Some aides give attitude instead of doing the task they were delegated. Some people take excessive breaks. I have worked here 2 separate times and I have no idea that I thought things would change for the better. People with poor communication skills act like they are the greatest employee ever. Backstabbing rampant. And I was expected to find coverage if my assigned weekend was when I wanted to take a week off.

pros: None at this time. None
cons: Supervisor called subordinate an idiot

review_title: I have only worked as an RN with UHC
pros: Good management, team work, opportunities for growth
cons: nurse retention, level of acuity, low staff volumes

pros: Good pay. Insurance is good
cons: Cliques people talk about you behind your back

pros: All of the coworkers and staff are really nice and they are willing to help.
cons: I do not have any cons at the moment

pros: Good nurses and doctors close to home
cons: The hours of the day I work

pros: Part of a large health system.
cons: Current culture is to cater to the physicians.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Bridgeport, WV
pros: Great benefits, great training, love patients
cons: Long hours, bad management, patient to nurse ratio extremely high

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Bridgeport, WV
pros: I have worked for UHC for five years. I feel it is a great place to work. I started as a full time employee and later decided to continue my education. After speaking with my manager at the time about my decision they allowed me to go to optional part time (OPT). That allowed me to pick the days I could work and be a full time student. The management has always been very accommodating of my class schedule and any life situations that have arose.
cons: The downside of working at UHC is they do not have system in place employees who continue their education in health care unless you are going for nursing. I am currently looking for employment because of this. I feel with being a reputable employee; my managers wrote me letters of recommendation as well as said if I ever go back to school for nursing I would  always have a place in my unit. They don’t have any positions open in the department I went to school for; they should come up with a system or something for this type of situation. They could hire these people as OPT until a position opened.

review_title: Would be great if management was better
pros:
The pay is decent
Clean Facility
Decent hours
cons:
Bad Management

Housekeepers are looked down upon

review_title: The work load is very heavy but I enjoy where I work.
pros: The flexibility of working optional part time is the reason I stay at UHC.  I work over 1000 hours a year and yet can get the days off that I need for my family situation.  Many of the people I work with are hard workers and do a good job.
cons: The work load is very heavy and people call off a lot.  Admission "computer" work is cumbersome and repetetive.  Many of the doctors seem rushed and do not check discharge orders carefully.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The lower lever people and fellow nurses are amazing. They function well together- those that weren't scabs.
cons:
Management does care about anything except profit. Patient care isn't a factor- showing the correct number is.  You frequently don't get breaks, you are chained to a computer- because that us the mist important thing because they can track it.
A huge number of travelers who are not safe to work with.

pros: Average pay, pretty good benefits even though they are always costing more and providing less and you have to shop at the company store (pharmacy) if you want even a slight bit of drug coverage.
cons: Bad management, exploitative policies. Policies are made based on one person abusing something and then selectively being enforced based on who you are and the direction of the wind. Long hours arent specified, but are surely expected. Any employee engagement benefits have been dwindling over the years to the point of being non existent now.

job_title: Optical Imaging Specialist in Bridgeport, WV
pros: Good health, eye, dental insurance and 401K. Employees were pretty good to work with.  You receive annual raises and free life insurance.
cons: Management doesn't help to correct issues, and tend  not to listen to employees ideas. Can be a very stressful job. The company appears to worry more about quantity instead of quality.

pros: I have worked here nearly 18 years.  Do give cost of living increases, and yearly raises. Great health benefits, vacation package.
cons: short staffed, poor morale. losing senior nurses, and unable to keep new nurses. Fearful for the outcome of our new beautiful hospital

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Bridgeport, WV
pros: If you are looking for a career in Nursing as a RN, UHC will help you make your dreams. On my floor we work as a team.
cons: Unless you have experience, there is no advancement unless you are looking to become a RN.  They do not cross train which is a flaw to myself.

job_title: Electrical Engineer Trainee in Bridgeport, WV
pros: People are friendly. training is good enough to get used to work
cons: Starts really early in the morning. you need to wake up 5:30 to have enough time to be there 7:00

review_title: Responsible for stocking the correct iv fluids in nursing stations
pros: the employees team work with each other
cons: Don't really know any cons about the place

pros: beautiful building,close to home. community hospital
cons: upper management. need to keep up with the changes in healthcare. poor communication. to many closed door hush hush meetings

job_title: Unit Seceretary in Bruceton Mills, WV
pros: Good staff, helpful staff, fun work environment
cons: Hospital staff not concerned with employees and issues

pros: Weight loss due to running all over the hospital due to poor decision layout and not enough staff.
cons: Lack of leadership. Good Ole Boys Club, if your manager is a male and in the club, they can break policies and not be reprimanded. High turnover due to lack of respect/staffing needs of associates.

cons: Upper management only cares about money and not the coworkers.
